summary.Title: Senior Project Control Engineer
summary.Presentation: For the Femern project, which is Northern Europe’s biggest construction project resulting in the longest immersed tunnel in the world, we are looking for Senior Project Control Engineer to provide

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
For the Femern project, which is Northern Europe’s biggest construction project resulting in the longest immersed tunnel in the world, we are looking for Senior Project Control Engineer to provide the Controls Division team with the expertise to deliver the project in the most effective manner and with solid scheduling & reporting updates and KPIs status.

Who is FLC?

Femern Link Contractors, FLC, is the joint venture responsible for the design and construction of the immersed tunnel, tunnel portals and ramps. Our joint venture consists of nine international construction companies with individual experience in large infrastructure projects.

Together, we are committed to working together to deliver a state-of-the-art immersed tunnel, portals and ramps, delivered on time and safely, in a sustainable and ethical manner.

Responsibilities:

At the pre-construction stage the Senior Project Control Engineer shall support the key stakeholders with the development of optimized tools to report and analyse project scopes and objectives. 

At the execution stage the Senior Project Control Engineer shall 1) Monitor, update, and communicate the variances of current status and the impact of project changes and variations. 2) Support, monitor, update, analyse and communicate the risks and opportunities of the Project.

The ideal candidate has an engineering and construction in heavy infrastructure background, contract and claims knowledge as well as risks and opportunities management, with the ability to work with strict deadlines and willing to learn and develop a career in the Project Control, claims, risks and opportunities field.

Main tasks:

Develop tools and optimize processes for the monthly progress reporting together with the cost control and planning team. 

  • Support the collection of datas to establish the monthly report
  • Support, develop and Implement Lean and Last Planner System meetings and procedures.
  • Support of execution team to define, collect and present the key figures, KPI of their production. Propose together with execution manager any improvements based on the analysis of the production datas presented.
  • Ensure that any discrepancies are analysed on a monthly basis and actions identified and communicated in a timely manner through various dashboards in Power-BI.
  • Prepare and update as appropriate any supporting documents for potential claims (cost calculation, schedule impact analysis).
  • Support with any Change Management / Time Impact analysis.   

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Civil Engineering, or similar.
  • +8 years’ experience in Planning, Scheduling and Control in EPC (Engineering, Procurement and Construction) of heavy infrastructure projects.
  • Competency with CPM scheduling software Oracle Primavera P6 EPPM.
  • Expert competency in Excel and Power-Bi.
  • Competency with Lean Construction approach and Last Planner System implementation.
  • Good understanding and experience on implementation of daily and monthly reporting processes and digital tools.
  • Good understanding of Construction industry heavy equipment and subcontractor’s management.
  • The ability to reconcile time and cost information.
  • Knowledge and practical application FIDIC or NEC form of contracts. 

Personal skills and competences:

  • Outstanding organizational abilities and technical mindset.
  • High ethical standards, honesty, and impeccable reputation.
  • Ability to manage multicultural teams and stakeholders on site and also remotely.
  • Resilient to coping with conflicting demands, able to prioritize duties and work under pressure.
  • Strong awareness of the level of interaction required with the key stakeholders’ teams to support the successful delivery of projects.
  • Good organizational skills, including the ability to organize the work of a team to meet agreed deadlines; ability to work independently or as part of a team, to agreed deadlines.
  • Strong analytical and reporting skills.
  • Strives for continuous improvement and precision in every detail.
  • Fluent in English; good command of technical terms.
  • Proactive and ensures an outside-in view to build business and create customer value.
  • Drives improvements, innovates and embraces challenges.
  • Shows the way and makes use of future talents.
  • Communicates with conviction, impact and respect.
  • Builds and leads diverse high performing teams and organizations.
  • Plans for success and manages by facts.
  • Drives results through focus and prioritization and is passionate.
  • Builds trust and holds people accountable.
  • Understands the business and does what is best for the company across the value chain.

Conditions of employment:

FLC considers transparent management structures, short decision-making channels, and a team-oriented environment to be extremely important. Our staff is expected to set themselves targets, achieve them independently, and take responsibility for their actions – irrespective of their position in the company. 

The Danish Salaried Employees Act (Funktionærloven) applies, pension, health insurance and lunch arrangement are available.

Starting date preferably 1 June 2022.

Your workplace will be Rødbyhavn with occational days in Copenhagen.

Application and contact:

We will invite for interviews on an ongoing basis.

For HR related questions to this position please contact HR Officer Jannie Bojesen on +45 2053 2071.
